intro: Stenorrhynchos arechavaletanii, commonly known as the Arechavaleta's stenorrhynchos, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to specific regions of Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
